title: Vicco chairman Gajanan Pendharkar no more
text:
Gajananrao Keshav Pendharkar Gajanan Pendharkar, a distinguished industrialist from Maharashtra and chairman of Vicco Group of Companies, passed away in Mumbai at his residence on Thursday.
He was 82.
The ailing Pendharkar breathed his last at his residence in the Mumbai suburb of Parel.
Born on September 12, 1934, Pendharkar joined the family business after getting degree in pharma in 1957. He began Vishnu Industries Chemical Company (Vicco) in 1,200 sq ft space and started promoting Ayurvedic products. The company went on to create new benchmarks not only in the Indian market but overseas as well. His companies continue to manufacture a wide range of Ayurvedic herbal medicinal products such as herbal toothpaste, herbal tooth powder, natural turmeric skin cream, herbal shaving cream and natural Ayurvedic pain relief cream, among others.
Over the last 45 years, Pendharkar was running the Vicco Group of Companies as its chairman and director. His companies put the variety of Ayurvedic products on the world map despite a stiff global challenge.
He was honoured with several awards such as 'Marathi Udyojakta Sanman' and 'Udyogratna Puraskar' for his outstanding achievements.
